pull.title: cmake: Avoid hardcoding Qt's major version in Find module / variable names
pull.body:
This PR facilitates future migration to Qt 6 and is a prerequisite for https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30997.

No behaviour change.

rename.from: cmake: Avoid hardcoding Qt's major version in Find module
rename.to: cmake: Avoid hardcoding Qt's major version in Find module / variable names

events.body: Seems fine with me, we could update the Qt5 to Qt6 as well, but i imagine removing the version number saves us work when we move to Qt7 in the future 😄

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -177,7 +177,7 @@ if(BUILD_GUI)
   if(BUILD_GUI_TESTS)
     list(APPEND qt_components Test)
   endif()
-  find_package(Qt5 5.11.3 MODULE REQUIRED
+  find_package(Qt 5.11.3 MODULE REQUIRED
comments.body: It seems to me we're still hardcoding the major version - can't we change this during migration instead?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -177,7 +177,7 @@ if(BUILD_GUI)
   if(BUILD_GUI_TESTS)
     list(APPEND qt_components Test)
   endif()
-  find_package(Qt5 5.11.3 MODULE REQUIRED
+  find_package(Qt 5.11.3 MODULE REQUIRED
comments.body:
> It seems to me we're still hardcoding the major version

I meant the variable names. The full minimum required version was not supposed to change.

> can't we change this during migration instead?

It is done in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30997. This PR split from it to make the https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30997 easier to review.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -56,11 +56,11 @@ else()
 endif()
 
 include(FindPackageHandleStandardArgs)
-find_package_handle_standard_args(Qt5
-  REQUIRED_VARS Qt5_DIR
-  VERSION_VAR Qt5_VERSION
+find_package_handle_standard_args(Qt
+  REQUIRED_VARS Qt${Qt_FIND_VERSION_MAJOR}_DIR
+  VERSION_VAR Qt${Qt_FIND_VERSION_MAJOR}_VERSION
comments.body: Do we need to keep the version variables here?
nit: is there a reason for keeping the `t` lowercase? Looks weird this way...

Variables such as `<PackageName>_FIND_VERSION`, `<PackageName>_FIND_VERSION_MAJOR`, and `<PackageName>_FIND_COMPONENTS`, are part of the `Find<PackageName>` module [interface](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/find_package.html#package-file-interface-variables). In our case, `<PackageName>` is replaced with `Qt`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -56,11 +56,11 @@ else()
 endif()
 
 include(FindPackageHandleStandardArgs)
-find_package_handle_standard_args(Qt5
-  REQUIRED_VARS Qt5_DIR
-  VERSION_VAR Qt5_VERSION
+find_package_handle_standard_args(Qt
+  REQUIRED_VARS Qt${Qt_FIND_VERSION_MAJOR}_DIR
+  VERSION_VAR Qt${Qt_FIND_VERSION_MAJOR}_VERSION
comments.body:
It logs the actual Qt version in the output:
```
-- Found Qt: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/Qt5 (found suitable version "5.15.13", minimum required is "5.11.3") 
```
Otherwise, the output will be less informative:
```
-- Found Qt: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/Qt5 (Required is at least version "5.11.3")
```
